review_blob: Light yellow. Carbonation you can see, its still bubbling a couple minutes after the pour. Smell is very mild. Kinda goes from light to heavy-ish, a little more bitter than Id like. Not a fan.

Bottle. I dont get any aroma from it, either the bottle or the glass. No head, golden yellow color. Tastes alright, smooth, light to moderate carbonation. Floral maybe, and citrus taste. Not a fan, kind of average.

Pours with no head. Looks like flat orange soda but kinda thick. Smells and tastes like honey. It isnt a very good beer, but its an interesting alcoholic beverage. I could take or leave it in the future, but Im glad I tried it.
beer_name: Shock Top Honey Bourbon Cask Wheat

review_blob: Didnt get much smell out of the bottle, but it comes out in the glass. Pours with a solid head that isnt too thick, but sticks around. Smells and tastes mildly of spice. Heavy, but very drinkable. Overall pretty good.

On tap at the brewer. Almost clear pink beer, it looks like blush wine. Very small amount of head. Aroma contains only a slight hint of strawberries and the taste has more. Might be a good summertime sipper, or palate cleanser, but not a great Foothills beer. I almost regret getting it, but I think Id regret not knowing, more.

On tap at the brewer. This one goes up to 11. So dark, almost black. Aroma is mild, doesnt boast about whats to come. Very heavy in the mouth and full of flavor. Amazing taste. You can definitely taste the bourbon. Foothills Brewing makes an amazing porter to start with and this only builds on that. Absolutely amazing.

On tap at the brewer. Flight size. Cant smell hardly anything. Very faint chocolate aroma after first sip. Very dark, thin head dissipated to the rim. Taste is mild as well, very smooth stout. More on the aftertaste. Expected a little more but dont regret trying it.
beer_name: Ass Clown Sour Dark Chocolate Sea Salt

review_blob: Bottle from the brewery. Pours dark red with a thin white head. Aroma is sweet but nondeScript, almost reminds me of apples but Im not sure. Taste is mild and fruity. Not bad, just uninteresting to me.

Bottle. Head fades to the edges. Smells amazing. Hard to put down. Really dark, deep red, cant see anything through it. Taste is really smooth, but the mocha promised in the name doesnt really come through until the aftertaste (and the aroma). Excellent, and amazing. Top porter.

Bottle. Pale orange, head fades to a faint ring around the edge. Smells fruity. Tastes like soda. Ive had a lot worse, but this deserves a little more than a rating of 1 out of 100. At least 10... Id put it above the basic Bud/Coors/Miller stuff. Its basically a fruity Corona.
Bottle. Mildly sweet aroma. Pours dark brown. Taste is slightly bitter, hard to place. Solid stout but Im not a fan of this one.
Bottle. Pours dark red to brown in the light, and the head almost completely fades. Smells of coffee with hints of chocolate. Taste is good but its slightly more carbonated than I would have liked.

Bottle. Aroma is sweet and wonderful, hard to place, with a little citrus. Whitest beer Ive ever seen. Its a very pale champagne yellow, with a fluffy white head that fades but doesnt completely go away. For the taste, at first its pure carbonation, but theres a softer, sweeter flavor behind it that is hard to place. I would prefer less carbonation and a little more hops, but the taste is simply wonderful. What a great beer.

Pours clean, almost no head. Smell is mild and hoppy. Hazy amber color. A lot of carbonation, a little bitter, but overall pleasing. Love the label. But Im somewhat divided on the actual ale. Its complex but vague and Im not sure how to label it, but overall, its just okay.
On tap at Off the Wagon in Manhattan. Only a bare hint of grain on the nose. Has a thick head that fades down to a thin lace. Taste is be bready with hints off citrus. Its okay.

beer_brewer_name: Coney Island Brewing Company (Boston Beer Company)
review_blob: On tap at Off the Wagon in NYC. Got nothing on the aroma. Golden yellow with a head that quickly fades. Taste is citrus and hops. Simple flavor. But very drinkable for as hoppy as it is.

Bottle. It looks like a cheap lager, and it smells and tastes like a decent one. That said, its not terrible. Id give a six pack to someone who only drinks cheap beer, as an invitation to try something better. Might drink again.
Bottle. Pours dark, murky brown. No head, just some bubbles in the middle. Smells sweet. Tastes sweet, hard to place. Very mild and drinkable. A very solid beer.
beer_name: Big Boss Bad Penny Brown Ale

review_blob: Bottle. Smells wonderful, but hard to place aroma. Sweet and full. Ale is murky, dark amber in the glass, with almost no head. Taste follows the aroma, with something sweet at the end. Feels heavy and full. Ends up just a little more bitter than Id like.

Bottle. Very dark, thin tan head. Smells like coffee. Taste is lighter than I expect, and the coffee flavor doesnt come through very strongly, but what does seems bitter. Not terrible but I cant count myself a fan.
Bottle. No head, deep brown color. Smells like chocolate and toffee. Taste is mild chocolate and mild hops. Overall rather plain and mild. Bottle is four months out of days, however.

Bottle. Smells a little fruity and a little like caramel and/or honey. Hard to place but smells sweet. Light orange, almost no head. Taste follows the smell with an almost overpowering aftertaste of sweet. Not bubbly at all. Best described as a dessert beer.

Bottle. Pours very light, pale yellow, almost straw color. Thin to moderate head which dissipates into a lace of bubbles. Smells wonderful; fruits and maybe hints of grass. Taste starts and finishes mild, with a little IPA bite right in the middle. On technical merits I enjoy it; I prefer it to the brewers year-round Ranger IPA, but its still a bit more bitter than I would prefer to drink.

[Happy St Paddys Day!] Can. Draught version. Pours black, with a quarter-inch tan head that doesnt go away even after you drink it all. Aroma is mild, and hard to place. Taste is extremely smooth and mellow for a stout. I taste chocolate, cream, and very slight hints of coffee. The taste is very deceptive for a stout, which I expect to be more bitter than this. I have to rate it highly, personally, for its easy drinkability vs my lack of experience with stouts.

Bottle. Smells wonderful but hard to place. Floral? Little fruity? Pours paddle yellow, thin head, fades to the edge with some lace in the middle. Taste follows the aroma with just a hint of bitterness. Its a little more bitter than Id like overall, but its a good pale ale.
Bottle. Dark, with tan head. Smells, tastes like caramel. Would definitely get this again.

Bottle. Pours damn near black with a light tan head which quickly fares to a line at the edge. Smells like coffee, almost burnt. The smell almost perfectly follows into the flavor with a rich, not burnt coffee aftertaste. Its a little more bitter than Id like, but I fear if it werent I might consider it a coffee drink and not a beer. Definitely a treat, would drink again for sure, but one is also enough.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy dark yellow, very light orange. Almost no head or lace. Smells vaguely fruity. Taste is a surprise, apricot maybe? Its got a good flavor. A little too fizzy for my tongue, but tasty. Id get it again.

Bottle. Pours nearly clear amber with little head and a lot of lacing. Aroma is sweet and woody; flavour is sweet, of raisins and spice. Strong flavor, but a really bitter finish and aftertaste. Id rate it higher if not for the aftertaste, and it could be a little less hoppy, but this beer does claim to double the hops from its non-seasonal counterpart, so thats to be expected.

Bottle. Smell is sweet and floral. Pours dark yellow, with a slightly off white head that fades to the edges, and lacing with a little oil in the middle. Taste is about what you should expect from a lager, but the aroma comes through with a hoppy vibe alongside it. This is a great example of a good beer.

Bottle. Smell is hard to place. Pours light orange. Tastes like a regular beer with a faint hint of honey. Head is off white with big bubbles on the edges. Its a decent beer but it doesnt stand out to me.

Nitro bottle. Pours dark amber, very nearly black, with little head but a little lacing. Smells of chocolate and malt, rich and appealing. Taste is a little less milk stout and more stout to me. Taste goes from something like molasses to slightly bitter. Overall it isnt bad.

Bottle. Pours murky straw/pineapple juice color, with a thin white head that dissipates into a lace. Aroma is mild fruity, with a little citrus flavor. Very mild beer, not bitter at all, maybe a little too sweet. Id love to drink these in the summer.

Bottle. Pours almost opaque amber, appears black in the glass. Light tan head, dissipates to the edges, which stick around. Smells like the sweeter end of the porter spectrum. Taste is sharp but not bitter, simple and to the point. Smoother than I expected. Nice sipping porter.
Bottle. Pours orange, mostly clear. Smells very faintly of the forest. Taste follows with that pine flavor. A little bubbly but a nice smooth IPA.

Bottle. Pours dark amber, not brown. I smell almost nothing, only the very lightest hint of malt. Taste follows the smell. I got nothing here. I hate to rate it so low when it doesnt do anything really wrong, but theres just nothing good to say. Maybe the bottle was past its prime. It has a date of 090613 on it, hopefully that isnt an expiration date.

Bottle. Smells lightly fruity. Pours translucent yellow with a little white head that fades down. Taste is a little fruity and it feels over carbonated, but its not unpleasant at all. I can dig it but Im not a fan.

Bottle. Pours clear, light orange. Smells and tastes very mild, hard to place it. A little too carbonated. Cant find much to like, but neither do I dislike it. Probably wont buy it again, but wouldnt mind of one were offered to me.
beer_name: Blue Moon Valencia Grove Amber Ale

review_blob: Bottle. Pours clear, golden yellow, with no head, just a little lacing. Smells sweet. Taste is sweet, a little sour, like fruit candy. A lot of flavors going on at once, not bitter at all. Will definitely buy again.
beer_name: Big Boss Hells Belle Belgian Blond

review_blob: Bottle, poured cellar temperature. Smells like dark roasted coffee and malt. Pours dark, dark red, nearly black, with a tan head. Taste starts sweet, followed by a taste that follows the smell, and finishes just bitter enough to let you know theres alcohol in it, not quite stout bitter, though. Good sipper. Would buy again.

Bottle. Aroma drops hints of coffee, malt, and chocolate. Pours reddish brown with a light tan head which fades to the rim with a little lace in the center. Taste starts to follow the aroma, but fades into something I cant placesome kind of toasty bread or something. This beer smells and tastes like a full working bakery. Great all around.

Bottle. Smells strongly of blueberry, and the taste follows. Looks like grape juice in the glass. Head is mostly carbonation, a reddish purple that fades quickly. It starts off with a basic lager flavor, which is quickly washed over with blueberry. I understand all the reasons beer snobs look down at this, but I enjoy it. Its not a complex porter or IPA, but it has its place.

Can. Saw a six-pack of cans I didnt recognize for $10.29. Looked it up on RateBeer, and the 97 score and some of the top ratings sold me. The smell is very mild, with hints of chocolate and coffee. It pours dark brown, and the tan head dissipated almost as soon as I poured it. This beer has a complex, heavy mouth feel. The taste follows the smell. Its almost not carbonated at all.And I cannot believe this has alcohol in it. Its so smooth. Would definitely buy again.

Bottle. Smells like chocolate. Pours dark brown with a finger thick tan head. Tastes like chocolate, with a faint hint of coffee. Goes down smooth. Might be a little too sweet. Would gladly drink again.
Bottle. Smells strongly of pumpkin, tastes of nutmeg and other spice. Pours murky amber with a little sediment. Aftertaste is just like a regular beer. Not bad.

Pint can. Pours murky light orange. Thick off white head quickly dissipates. Hard to read anything in the smell; I barely smell beer at all. Taste is pleasant, but nondeScript and more carbonated than Id like. Better in the bottle.

Bottle. Smells fruity and a little woody. Pours translucent golden with a thin off white head. Taste follows the more grassy, woody part of the smell but is very mild and agreeable. Overall I find this pale ale very enjoyable, although I expected a little more complexity on the palate.

Bottle. Smells like pine. Pours amber, a little hazy with an off white lace. Has a woodsy flavor, complex but not too bitter, except in the aftertaste, which stays with me longer than I expected. Not sure if Id ever want more than one, but it would go great with a nice meal?something like baked chicken, rice, and steamed vegetables. Served outdoors overlooking a forest.

Bottle. Pours pale yellow, a little hazy with a white head that dissipates to a lace. Strong raspberry aroma. Tastes a little sour, kind of like cough syrup. Its not terrible, but not a taste I enjoy.
Bottle. Smells strongly of blueberry, but just tastes like wheat and bubbles with a slight hint of the smell. Clear, yellow, no head. More than the sum of its parts.
